title: Vorpal jabberwock
data:
The **vorpal jabberwock** is an [unused monster](/wiki/Unused_monster "Unused monster") in vanilla [NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack") which has been implemented in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack"), [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), and [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack").

In every incarnation, the vorpal jabberwock is a more powerful version of the regular [jabberwock](/wiki/Jabberwock "Jabberwock"), appearing as J. Like the regular jabberwock, it is especially vulnerable to being beheaded by [Vorpal Blade](/wiki/Vorpal_Blade "Vorpal Blade") (and other methods of decapitation, depending on the variant).

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 GruntHack](#GruntHack)
- [2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
- [3 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
- [4 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
- [5 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
- [6 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## GruntHack

| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **[Difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty")**                                                      | 27                                                             |
| **Attacks**                                                                                                          | Bite 3d10, Bite 3d10, Claw beheading 3d10, Claw beheading 3d10 |
|                                                                                                                      |                                                                |

| J vorpal jabberwock [![Vorpal jabberwock.png](/images/4/42/Vorpal_jabberwock.png)](/wiki/File:Vorpal_jabberwock.png)                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         |                                                                |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **[Difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              | 27                                                             |

|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |                                                                |

| **[Base MR](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               | 50                                                             |
| **[Alignment](/wiki/Alignment#Monster_alignment "Alignment")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               | 0 (neutral)                                                    |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |                                                                |
| **[Frequency](/wiki/Monster_frequency "Monster frequency")** (by [normal means](/wiki/Normal_mechanism "Normal mechanism"))                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  | 1 (Very rare)                                                  |
| **[Genocidable](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 | Yes                                                            |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |                                                                |
| **[Weight](/wiki/Weight "Weight")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          | 1300                                                           |
| **[Nutritional value](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         | 600                                                            |
| **[Size](/wiki/Physical_size "Physical size")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              | Large                                                          |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |                                                                |
| **[Resistances](/wiki/Resistance "Resistance")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             | None                                                           |
| **Resistances [conveyed](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            | None                                                           |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |                                                                |
| A vorpal jabberwock:* can [fly](/wiki/Fly "Fly").
* is an [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal").
* is [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivore "Carnivore").
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* is [nasty](/wiki/M2_NASTY "M2 NASTY").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                                |

The vorpal jabberwock possesses multiple [beheading](/wiki/Instadeath "Instadeath") attacks, each with a 5% chance of instantly beheading you on every successful hit (100% chance if you are polymorphed into a jabberwock or vorpal jabberwock yourself; 0% if you are currently headless or [amorphous](/wiki/Amorphous "Amorphous")). Additionally, jabberwocks can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into vorpal jabberwocks.

## UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), the vorpal jabberwock behaves very similarly to GruntHack's version, except that the chance of beheading is only 2.5% per hit, and [canceling](/wiki/Cancel "Cancel") the vorpal jabberwock prevents it from beheading anything.

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Vorpal_jabberwock\&action=edit)*

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"Please verify: beheading chance seems more like 20% and cancelling seems to not be possible"*

## EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), the vorpal jabberwock behaves very similarly to GruntHack's version. Additionally, it is one of the alternate forms the [Wizard of Yendor](/wiki/Wizard_of_Yendor "Wizard of Yendor") may take on, monsters may use a wish for a figurine of a vorpal jabberwock, and they cannot be genocided.

* is an [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal").
* is [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivore "Carnivore").
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* is [nasty](/wiki/M2_NASTY "M2 NASTY").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* does not appear in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom").
* hits creatures as a +3 weapon. |                                                                                                                  |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |                                                                                                                  |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          | [SLASH'EM\_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line2683](/wiki/SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line2683 "SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c") |

The [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") version of the vorpal jabberwock possesses no beheading attack, will not grow up from a regular jabberwock, does not generate in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"), and is not especially vulnerable to being decapitated by Vorpal Blade.

## SpliceHack

[SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack")'s vorpal jabberwock acts mostly like SLASH'EM's version, except that Vorpal Blade will still always decapitate it.

## Encyclopedia entry

"Beware the Jabberwock, my son!  
  The jaws that bite, the claws that catch!  
Beware the Jubjub bird, and shun  
  The frumious Bandersnatch!"  
  
He took his vorpal sword in hand;  
  Long time the manxome foe he sought --  
So rested he by the Tumtum tree,  
  And stood awhile in thought.  
  
And, as in uffish thought he stood,  
  The Jabberwock, with eyes of flame,  
Came whiffling through the tulgey wood,  
  And burbled as it came!  
  
One, two! One, two! And through and through  
  The vorpal blade went snicker-snack!  
He left it dead, and with its head  
  He went galumphing back.

\[ Jabberwocky, by Lewis Carroll ]
html:
Vorpal jabberwock

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

The vorpal jabberwock is an unused monster in vanilla NetHack which has been implemented in SLASH'EM, GruntHack, UnNetHack, SpliceHack, and EvilHack.

In every incarnation, the vorpal jabberwock is a more powerful version of the regular jabberwock, appearing as J. Like the regular jabberwock, it is especially vulnerable to being beheaded by Vorpal Blade (and other methods of decapitation, depending on the variant).

Contents

  • 1 GruntHack
  • 2 UnNetHack
  • 3 EvilHack
  • 4 SLASH'EM
  • 5 SpliceHack
  • 6 Encyclopedia entry

GruntHack

J vorpal jabberwock
Difficulty 27
Attacks Bite 3d10, Bite 3d10, Claw beheading 3d10, Claw beheading 3d10
J vorpal jabberwock
Difficulty 27
Attacks

Bite 3d10, Bite 3d10, Claw beheading 3d10, Claw beheading 3d10

Base level 20
Base experience 809
Speed 12
Base AC -2
Base MR 50
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 1300
Nutritional value 600
Size Large
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A vorpal jabberwock:

  • can fly.
  • is an animal.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is nasty.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can be seen through infravision.

The vorpal jabberwock possesses multiple beheading attacks, each with a 5% chance of instantly beheading you on every successful hit (100% chance if you are polymorphed into a jabberwock or vorpal jabberwock yourself; 0% if you are currently headless or amorphous). Additionally, jabberwocks can grow up into vorpal jabberwocks.

UnNetHack

In UnNetHack, the vorpal jabberwock behaves very similarly to GruntHack's version, except that the chance of beheading is only 2.5% per hit, and canceling the vorpal jabberwock prevents it from beheading anything.

This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

"Please verify: beheading chance seems more like 20% and cancelling seems to not be possible"

EvilHack

In EvilHack, the vorpal jabberwock behaves very similarly to GruntHack's version. Additionally, it is one of the alternate forms the Wizard of Yendor may take on, monsters may use a wish for a figurine of a vorpal jabberwock, and they cannot be genocided.

SLASH'EM

J vorpal jabberwock
Difficulty 27
Attacks Bite 3d10, Bite 3d10, Claw 3d10, Claw 3d10
J vorpal jabberwock
Difficulty 27
Attacks

Bite 3d10, Bite 3d10, Claw 3d10, Claw 3d10

Base level 20
Base experience 809
Speed 12
Base AC -2
Base MR 50
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 1300
Nutritional value 600
Size Large
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A vorpal jabberwock:

  • can fly.
  • is an animal.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • is nasty.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • does not appear in Gehennom.
  • hits creatures as a +3 weapon.
Reference SLASH'EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line2683

The SLASH'EM version of the vorpal jabberwock possesses no beheading attack, will not grow up from a regular jabberwock, does not generate in Gehennom, and is not especially vulnerable to being decapitated by Vorpal Blade.

SpliceHack

SpliceHack's vorpal jabberwock acts mostly like SLASH'EM's version, except that Vorpal Blade will still always decapitate it.

Encyclopedia entry

"Beware the Jabberwock, my son!
  The jaws that bite, the claws that catch!
Beware the Jubjub bird, and shun
  The frumious Bandersnatch!"

He took his vorpal sword in hand;
  Long time the manxome foe he sought --
So rested he by the Tumtum tree,
  And stood awhile in thought.

And, as in uffish thought he stood,
  The Jabberwock, with eyes of flame,
Came whiffling through the tulgey wood,
  And burbled as it came!

One, two! One, two! And through and through
  The vorpal blade went snicker-snack!
He left it dead, and with its head
  He went galumphing back.

[ Jabberwocky, by Lewis Carroll ]

rawPage:
The '''vorpal jabberwock''' is an [[unused monster]] in vanilla [[NetHack]] which has been implemented in [[SLASH'EM]], [[GruntHack]], [[UnNetHack]], [[SpliceHack]], and [[EvilHack]].

In every incarnation, the vorpal jabberwock is a more powerful version of the regular [[jabberwock]], appearing as {{magenta|J}}. Like the regular jabberwock, it is especially vulnerable to being beheaded by [[Vorpal Blade]] (and other methods of decapitation, depending on the variant).

== GruntHack ==
{{monster
 |name=vorpal jabberwock
 |difficulty=27
 |level=20
 |experience=809
 |speed=12
 |AC=-2
 |MR=50
 |align=0
 |frequency=1
 |genocidable=Yes
 |attacks=Bite 3d10, Bite 3d10, Claw beheading 3d10, Claw beheading 3d10
 |resistances conveyed=None
 |resistances=None
 |attributes={{attributes|A vorpal jabberwock|animal=1|fly=1|carnivore=1|hostile=1|strong=1|nasty=1|collect=1|infravisible=1}}
 |size=Large
 |nutr=600
 |weight=1300
}} 

The vorpal jabberwock possesses multiple [[instadeath|beheading]] attacks, each with a 5% chance of instantly beheading you on every successful hit (100% chance if you are polymorphed into a jabberwock or vorpal jabberwock yourself; 0% if you are currently headless or [[amorphous]]). Additionally, jabberwocks can [[grow up]] into vorpal jabberwocks.

== UnNetHack ==
In [[UnNetHack]], the vorpal jabberwock behaves very similarly to GruntHack's version, except that the chance of beheading is only 2.5% per hit, and [[cancel]]ing the vorpal jabberwock prevents it from beheading anything.
{{stub|Please verify: beheading chance seems more like 20% and cancelling seems to not be possible}}

== EvilHack ==
In [[EvilHack]], the vorpal jabberwock behaves very similarly to GruntHack's version. Additionally, it is one of the alternate forms the [[Wizard of Yendor]] may take on, monsters may use a wish for a figurine of a vorpal jabberwock, and they cannot be genocided.

{{clear}}

== SLASH'EM ==
{{monster
 |name=vorpal jabberwock
 |difficulty=27
 |level=20
 |experience=809
 |speed=12
 |AC=-2
 |MR=50
 |align=0
 |frequency=1
 |genocidable=Yes
 |attacks=Bite 3d10, Bite 3d10, Claw 3d10, Claw 3d10
 |resistances conveyed=None
 |resistances=None
 |attributes={{attributes|A vorpal jabberwock|nohell=1|animal=1|fly=1|carnivore=1|hostile=1|strong=1|nasty=1|collect=1|infravisible=1|hitasthree=1}}
 |size=Large
 |nutr=600
 |weight=1300
 |reference=[[SLASH'EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line2683]]
}}

The [[SLASH'EM]] version of the vorpal jabberwock possesses no beheading attack, will not grow up from a regular jabberwock, does not generate in [[Gehennom]], and is not especially vulnerable to being decapitated by Vorpal Blade.

== SpliceHack ==
[[SpliceHack]]'s vorpal jabberwock acts mostly like SLASH'EM's version, except that Vorpal Blade will still always decapitate it.

{{clear}}
==Encyclopedia entry==

{{encyclopedia|	"Beware the Jabberwock, my son!
  The jaws that bite, the claws that catch!
Beware the Jubjub bird, and shun
  The frumious Bandersnatch!"

He took his vorpal sword in hand;
  Long time the manxome foe he sought --
So rested he by the Tumtum tree,
  And stood awhile in thought.

And, as in uffish thought he stood,
  The Jabberwock, with eyes of flame,
Came whiffling through the tulgey wood,
  And burbled as it came!

One, two! One, two! And through and through
  The vorpal blade went snicker-snack!
He left it dead, and with its head
  He went galumphing back.|[ Jabberwocky, by Lewis Carroll ]
